intro: Eurya degeneri, commonly known as the Japanese evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to eastern Asia, including Japan, Korea, and China, and is characterized by its dense, glossy evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Eurya degeneri typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters in its natural habitat. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest environments.
